data.title: What a Dive! Lots of drafts to choose from
data.text: Ended up here on a recent business trip looking for a evening cocktail.  Smelled like vomit and stale beer.  Very busy on a Thursday night. great to people watch but beware the weirdo's.  They do have employees who watch out for the crowd but still be on your guard.  Bathrooms are disgusting.

data.title: "Average" is the absolutely wrong word to describe this place
data.text:
Mixed feelings about this bar - not at all my type of place, but it's a destination of sorts and it's worth a visit for the experience. We went on a Tuesday night and it was not crowded, but it was still very loud. The music is loud, and at times someone makes deafening announcements over a PA system. For the craft beer aficionados, there were a decent number of good choices, including Ninkasi, Stone, Deschutes, Lagunitas. There are special hours of the day for half-price drinks - look on their website for the details, it's kind of a game to get there at the right time.

You have to stand in line at the bar to get your drinks. If you want peanuts, you have to ask for them. Yes, there are shells all over the floor. Yes, the place overall is fairly grubby, but the table we sat down at had been wiped and was clean enough for our elbows. The ladies restroom was clean enough to use. I am not that picky, honestly - I believe our immune systems are developed by exposure to dirt and germs, and this would be a fine place to develop your immune system, drink good cheap beers, and blast the cobwebs out of your head with loud music. Go for the fun of it. Get a pitcher. Don't be a snob. Don't be too old to enjoy a dive bar.

data.title: Quirky Dive Bar
data.text:
I visited this bar about 20 years ago with some friends for a bachelor party.  Since I don't get down to the Coast Mesa area very often, I have never been back.  Recently, while on a business trip to Orange County, I decided to go back and see how things have changed.  Amazingly, very little had.  There was still the collection of weird and interesting things on the walls and ceiling, they still had more beers on tap than I've ever seen, they still had peanuts in the shell for snacking on, and my favorite part, the semi-outdoor area with pool tables, foosball, and shuffleboard table.  I was there on a Thursday evening and it was packed with people.  Obviously, the place has survived this long because other people think it's a cool place also.

I recommend driving around back to find parking.  There was plenty back there plus a rear entrance.  

This is not a place to take someone you want to impress.  This is a casual, fun place where you can relax and just have fun.  I just wish I lived closer so I could stop by more often.

data.title: Too crowded.
data.text: Hard to get a drink. Too crowded. Kind of dumpy. Place used to be fun back in the day. Drinks aren't as stiff as the used to be.

data.title: Had to leave because of the stink!
data.text: We walked in and sat down at the bar on a warm afternoon in March.  It was hot and stale inside and smelled like the beer on the floor hadn't been scrubbed out in decades.  After 10 minutes of getting no service we walked ... no RAN out the door and were very happy we did.

data.title: Goat Hill Tavern
data.text:
The Goat Hill Tavern is what one would consider the upper-end of the dive bar scene. Its rustic setting means that the crowd can and will get loud and out of control from time to time. The location is smack dab in the upper Newport Beach club scene and a short distance from Triangle Square, a hub of food and clubs. 

You will find the patrons at the Goat Hill Tavern to be some of Newport/ Costa Mesa's best. They are great fun, lively and always ready to have a good time. The cocktails are stiff and the beer is not over priced. They have over 100 different brews all on tap so obviously beer is a big deal here.

data.title: NEED GAS MASK BEFORE ENTER
data.text: ThE PlacE SmelL LIke VOMIT And iT  haS A Lot Of SmellY SmokerS. due  to tHe NASty SmeIL, wE  LEft RighT AWay.

data.title: The Goat!
data.text:
GOAT = Greatest Of All Time 
Enough said! This is quite the best dive bar this side of the Mississippi! I frequent this place on special occasions. Thought its like a high school reunion it's a great place to have a drink and kick back.

data.title: Quintessentially American Bar
data.text:
The great thing about this bar (which is not, as you might see reported here, a "restaurant") is its atmosphere. Old street signs, football shirts, old pictures coming from who-knows-where, a juke box, wooden tables: once you step in, if you're a foreigner, you immediately recognize this bar even if you've never set eyes on it. It's the same as you've seen in movies, as the local haunt of so many American towns...
And yet it is not a tourist bar: you notice immediately how people are used to it, they make it their own Friday night place, they love playing table-soccer there with their friends.
Oh, and they have so many beers - local and imported, mainstream and crafted. You can spend hours staring at the menu that is hung above the bar. Most of them are good.

data.title: A dive Bar
data.text: Very good bar, all beers on tap, broad and complete listing of craft beers.  No food, so don't go here to eat, but a good plae to go for a good beer, peanuts and chips. Many local decorations, and this is apparently what Costa Mesa was know for years ago,  so check it out!

data.title: Dive Bar And Cheap Beer
data.text: GHT is a basic dive bar with crusty decor, peanuts on the floor, flat screens everywhere and basement frat house style Devore. $6 beer pitchers are good. Peanuts are 50 cents. It's an ugly bar with friendly people and faded Decor. The music mix is odd. Plenty of sports on TVs, good seating, pool tables and pretty spacious. The women's restroom was filthy. If you like a dive bar with cheap prices, you'll love it.

data.title: Service and watered down drinks suck...
data.text: I cant believe how bad we were treated by the bartender. My drink was all water. The bathroom door locks were broke and the door leading out to the bar wouldnt close. It smelled really bad in the bar. We will never go back.

data.title: What an Atmosphere
data.text: First night in LA on business and a recommended trip to the Goat Hill Tavern was followed, brilliant atmosphere in a brilliant bar......thanks to Phil pick for the tour guide advice. Would recommend a trip here for everyone.

data.title: Excellent Beer Variety
data.text: This place has so many beers on tap, I'm not about to try to assign an exact number. I love the variety of beers as well. This place has stuff on tap that 98% of bars don't even carry in any form. Fun, loud bar atmosphere, even on a Wednesday night.They have a section of the bar that technically is outdoors(although it really isn't) that allows smoking. I don't like this fact, but many people do, as it is a somewhat unique attribute of this bar.

data.title: Old School Bar
data.text: Have visited this place in 2010 and again in 2012. The atmosphere is excellent and the happy hour deals are unmissable. Really enjoyed this place and had serious banter playing pool with some locals.

data.title: almost too much choice
data.text: What a great bar! A huge selection of different beers of all styles, good music and a (younger) but eclectic clientele.

data.title: Nasty Place - Nasty People
data.text:
What a dump! ("Dive" is reserved for more classy establishments.)

We could not determine what was more filthy - the patrons, restrooms or manners of their less than charming bar concierge, "Ian." (The latter has fully embraced the career option of pandering exclusively to losers for dollar tips in a jar.)

PS: When you arrive to see a line of cabs in the carpark waiting for the inevitable fares, you kinda get the hint you are about to enter Drunk Central.

Enjoy - if you've had all your shots and consider slumming with trash more than a spectator sport.

data.title: Cheap drinks from 8-9 sun-wed
data.text: This place is a great dive bar with some sweet drink deals during the week....50% off all drinks(I was getting pitchers of High Life for $5.25..!!)from 8-9 sun-wed...7-8 Thurs and 5-6 on fri...great deals....and big bowls of peanuts for $3...

data.title: Anyone that has issues with the GOAT, has have issues with themself not the GOAT.
data.text:
I have an incredible fondness for The Goat for many reasons. My last birthday was spent enjoying it at this wonderful place where refined beer flows from great bartenders that are happy handing you your next delicious adventure of beer. It is a place without snootiness or image building. Its about beer, conversation, sports and having a good time. Outsiders are easy to spot and mostly people are in good moods unless their team lost. 

For those that wrote not liking that the place doesnt have food, it doesnt say "Goat Hill Tavern and Food." Tavern implies beer, if you want food order it to be delivered. They let you do that. The bouncers are pretty much in the top standings of the nice security guards, no douchery. Two things about this place that make it my favorite place, it helped provide the location of the beginning of my learning about beer because they have so many great beers available and I am a changed woman! There is nothing better than a good beer, so much more complicated than people treat it. Second, its a regular spot for myself and the boyfriend that tue bartenders know us. 

Its great, just go and stop looking at this website trying to decide.

data.title: Great place for good Beer ... despite being a little dirty/smelly
data.text: I finally made it to The Goat Hill Tavern and it is much like I had anticipated from the reviews.    The bar itself is unique ... and sometimes dirty and smelly.  It can get quite crowded on Friday & Saturday night.  Earlier in the evening is a little more chill during their Founders Hour & Guiness Hour.  Overall, I think the Goat is a great place to enjoy a good imperial pint of beer (from one of their 141 taps) and soak up a little old school OC culture.
